Northumberland 'served common good of humanity'</h1><h2 class="LeadText_lead-text__wd_PA __className_e2154c" data-testid="leadtext">Captain Muldowney, who was shot dead in Otterburn during a live-fire training exercise, has been described as 'rising star'</h2><button class="SlideViewerButton_slide-viewer-button__BDJoG" aria-label="Open image viewer" aria-haspopup="dialog" class="ImageCaption_caption-credit__wlx1W" data-testid="caption-credit">(Image: PA)</cite></p></figcaption></div></button><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">A funeral was held for <a aria-label="Army officer Captain Philip Gilbert Muldowney, who was killed in a training incidentLink opens in a new tab." class="TextLink_text-link__dBSS0 TextLink_enabled__dJF3l" href="https://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/news/north-east-news/british-army-officer-shot-dead-33313795" rel="follow" tabindex="0" target="_blank">Army officer Captain Philip Gilbert Muldowney, who was killed in a training incident</a> at Otterburn, <a aria-label="Northumberland,Link opens in a new tab." class="TextLink_text-link__dBSS0 TextLink_enabled__dJF3l" href="https://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/all-about/northumberland" rel="follow" tabindex="0" target="_blank">Northumberland,</a> on Sunday, January 25. Family, friends, and loved ones gathered to honour him in his home country of Ireland.</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">Otterburn, <a aria-label="one of the UK's largest army training rangesLink opens in a new tab." class="TextLink_text-link__dBSS0 TextLink_enabled__dJF3l" href="https://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/all-about/armed-forces" rel="follow" tabindex="0" target="_blank">one of the UK's largest army training ranges</a>, was the site of the incident, which occurred during a live-fire exercise. <a aria-label="Specific details about the incident have not been disclosed.Link opens in a new tab." class="TextLink_text-link__dBSS0 TextLink_enabled__dJF3l" href="https://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/news/north-east-news/british-troops-complete-northumberland-training-33343543" rel="follow" tabindex="0" target="_blank">Specific details about the incident have not been disclosed.</a></p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">Captain Muldowney grew up in County Roscommon and served as a fire support commander with the 129 (Dragon) Battery of the 4th Regiment Royal Artillery. Locally known as Gilbert, he spent his childhood in Ballinameen, near Boyle, after his family relocated from Dublin.</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">Mr Muldowney's coffin was carried into the chapel by uniformed officers. Representatives from the Irish Defence Forces and members of Mr Muldowney's local GAA club were also in attendance.</p><p class="BoxStyles_box-container__Qk3WH BoxStyles_non-commercial__aiWwo undefined" data-testid="recommended-1" data-position="4"></p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">At St Attracta's Church, Ballinameen, Bishop Kevin Doran told those gathered that Capt Muldowney brought "joy and hope" to those around him. His colleagues and friends from the Army who Bishop Doran said "were closest to him at the time of his death" were at the service on Saturday.</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">Reverend Captain Henry Afful was in attendance alongside Colonel Sean Grant, defence attache to the British embassy, Colonel Harry Waller, commanding officer in the Fourth Regiment Royal Artillery and Colonel William Tulloch, First Battalion Scots Guards Commander.</p><p class="BoxStyles_box-container__Qk3WH BoxStyles_non-commercial__aiWwo undefined" data-testid="non-commercial-1" data-position="6"></p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">Bishop Doran, who conducted the service, said the community was sharing stories about Captain Muldowney as they mourned his loss.</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">He said: "Many stories have been told about Gilbert over cups of tea and coffee, and many more will be told before the day is out, stories of his escapades and of his commitment, his interest in archery and brewing, to mention but a few."</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">Bishop Doran continued: "It's an anxious time, not least for soldiers and for the families of soldiers. I suppose soldiers train for war in the hope that it will never come.</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">"They prepare so that others may live in peace. Jesus encourages us not to lose hope in the face of all that is wrong in the world."</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">Doran said that Capt Muldowney was "called to serve the common good of humanity." He concluded by preaching "that our ultimate good is achieved not by seeking our own glory, but by laying down our lives for one another".</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">Among the items brought to the altar during the service were walking boots as a symbol of his love of the mountains, a longbow handmade by Capt Muldowney, his favourite book, The Count Of Monte Cristo, and his St Christopher's medal as a "symbol of his love of jewellery, his faith and his delight in travelling".</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">Bishop Doran added: "We're called to give our hearts to Jesus, who said to live by his word, it can take a whole lifetime, but as we have seen in Gilbert's case, a lifetime sometimes has to be fitted into a few short years.</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">"We give thanks today for all that Gilbert achieved in such a short space of time, for all the joy and hope he brought to his family and friends."</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">Capt Muldowney joined the Army on January 5 2020, commissioning into the Royal Artillery on December 11 2020, after attending the Royal Military Academy Sandhurst. He graduated from Elphin Community College in 2019, and the school's principal, Anne Gilleran, said Captain Muldowney "is spoken of with enormous respect and affection by staff who knew him well".</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">The Ministry of Defence said Capt Muldowney was an "immensely enthusiastic officer who embraced life with a vigour that inspired those around him".</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">Commanding Officer of 4th Regiment Royal Artillery, Lieutenant Colonel Henry Waller said: "It is with deep sadness that we announce the death of Captain Philip Gilbert Muldowney. Known to all simply as Gilbert, he was an immensely enthusiastic officer who embraced life with a vigour that inspired everyone around him.</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">"Professionally, Gilbert was an outstanding officer who consistently put his soldiers first. He led from the front in all that he did, a quality that defined his character.</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">"His leadership, courage, and sense of duty earned him the respect and admiration of all who served alongside him.</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">"Friends and colleagues will remember Gilbert for his easy-going nature, boundless energy, and infectious sense of humour. He had an extraordinary ability to lift spirits and make the best of any situation, leaving a lasting impression on all who knew him.</p><p class="Paragraph_paragraph-text__PVKlh " data-tmdatatrack="content-unit" data-tmdatatrack-type="paragraph">"Gilbert was an unforgettable character and a rising star within the Army and the Regiment. His loss is deeply felt by his comrades and friends, and our thoughts and prayers are with his family at this most difficult time."</p></article></div></body></html>
